Generation I.Red: Often mistaken for eggs. When disturbed, they quickly gather and attack in swarms.
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: Often mistaken for eggs. When disturbed, they quickly gather and attack in swarms.
Generation I.Yellow: The heads attract each other and spin around. There must be 6 heads for it to maintain balance.
Generation I.Stadium: A Pokémon that is like the seeds of a plant. If you find one and chase it, others will join it without you noticing.

Generation II.Gold: The shell is very durable. Even if it cracks, it can survive without spilling the contents.
Generation II.Silver: Using telepathy only they can receive, they always form a cluster of six Exeggcute .
Generation II.Crystal: If even one is separated from the group, the energy bond between the six will make them rejoin instantly.
Generation II.Stadium 2: The shell is very durable. Even if it cracks, it can survive without spilling the contents. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) Using telepathy only they can receive, they always form a cluster of six Exeggcute . (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: This Pok é mon consists of six eggs that form a closely knit cluster. The six eggs attract each other and spin around. When cracks increasingly appear on the eggs, Exeggcute is close to evolution.
Generation III.Sapphire: This Pok é mon consists of six eggs that form a closely knit cluster. The six eggs attract each other and spin around. When cracks increasingly appear on the eggs, Exeggcute is close to evolution.
Generation III.Emerald: It consists of six eggs that care for each other. The eggs attract each other and spin around. When cracks increasingly appear, it is close to evolution.
Generation III.FireRed: Even though it appears to be eggs of some sort, it was discovered to be a life-form more like plant seeds.
Generation III.LeafGreen: It is often mistaken for eggs. When disturbed, they quickly gather and attack in swarms.

Generation IV.Diamond: Its six eggs converse using telepathy. They can quickly gather if they become separated.
Generation IV.Pearl: Its six eggs converse using telepathy. They can quickly gather if they become separated.
Generation IV.Platinum: Its six eggs converse using telepathy. They can quickly gather if they become separated.
Generation IV.HeartGold: Their shells are very durable. Even if they crack, they can survive without spilling their contents.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: Using telepathy only they can employ, they always form a cluster of six Exeggcute .

Generation V.Black: Its six eggs converse using telepathy. They can quickly gather if they become separated.
Generation V.White: Its six eggs converse using telepathy. They can quickly gather if they become separated.
Generation V.Black 2: Its six eggs converse using telepathy. They can quickly gather if they become separated.
Generation V.White 2: Its six eggs converse using telepathy. They can quickly gather if they become separated.

Generation VI.X: Its six eggs converse using telepathy. They can quickly gather if they become separated.
Generation VI.Y: Even though it appears to be eggs of some sort, it was discovered to be a life-form more like plant seeds.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: This Pokémon consists of six eggs that form a closely knit cluster. The six eggs attract each other and spin around. When cracks increasingly appear on the eggs, Exeggcute is close to evolution.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: This Pokémon consists of six eggs that form a closely knit cluster. The six eggs attract each other and spin around. When cracks increasingly appear on the eggs, Exeggcute is close to evolution.

Generation VII.Sun: Its six eggs use telepathy to communicate among themselves. It is believed to carry plant genes and the genes of other species.
Generation VII.Moon: Six of them together form a full-fledged Pokémon. It's often hunted by Crabrawler , but uses psychokinesis to drive it off.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: Six of them form a single Pokémon. Should one of the six be lost, the next morning there will once more be six.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: Although they are the same size as other Exeggcute, the ones produced in Alola are quite heavy. Their shells are packed full.
Generation VII.Let's Go Pikachu: The heads attract each other and spin around. There must be six heads for it to maintain balance.
Generation VII.Let's Go Eevee: The heads attract each other and spin around. There must be six heads for it to maintain balance.

Generation VIII.Sword: Though it may look like it's just a bunch of eggs, it's a proper Pokémon. Exeggcute communicates with others of its kind via telepathy, apparently.
Generation VIII.Shield: These Pokémon get nervous when they're not in a group of six. The minute even one member of the group goes missing, Exeggcute become cowardly.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: Its six eggs converse using telepathy. They can quickly gather if they become separated.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: Its six eggs converse using telepathy. They can quickly gather if they become separated.

Generation IX.Scarlet: If you touch one of Exeggcute’s heads, mistaking it for an egg, the other heads will quickly gather and attack you in a swarm.
Generation IX.Violet: Using telepathy only fellow Exeggcute can pick up on, they always form a cluster of six.

Generation II.Gold: Routes 26 , 27 , 34 , 35 , 36 , 37 , 38 , and 39 , Azalea Town , Ilex Forest , Lake of Rage ( Headbutt trees )
Generation II.Silver: Routes 26 , 27 , 34 , 35 , 36 , 37 , 38 , and 39 , Azalea Town , Ilex Forest , Lake of Rage ( Headbutt trees )
Generation II.Crystal: Routes 26 , 27 , 29 , 30 , 31 , 32 , 34 , 35 , 36 , 37 , 38 , 39 , and 43 , Lake of Rage ( Headbutt trees )

Generation IV.HeartGold: Routes 26 , 27 , 29 , 30 , 31 , 32 , 34 , 35 , 36 , 37 , 38 , 39 , 43 , 47 , and 48 , New Bark Town , Cherrygrove City , Violet City , Ecruteak City , National Park , Lake of Rage , Safari Zone Gate ( Headbutt trees )
Generation IV.SoulSilver: Routes 26 , 27 , 29 , 30 , 31 , 32 , 34 , 35 , 36 , 37 , 38 , 39 , 43 , 47 , and 48 , New Bark Town , Cherrygrove City , Violet City , Ecruteak City , National Park , Lake of Rage , Safari Zone Gate ( Headbutt trees )

Generation VII.Sun: Ancient Poni Path , Exeggutor Island , Poni Wilds
Generation VII.Moon: Ancient Poni Path , Exeggutor Island , Poni Wilds

Generation VIII.Expansion Pass: Insular Sea , Stepping-Stone Sea , Workout Sea Soothing Wetlands , Forest of Focus , Challenge Beach , Training Lowlands ( Max Raid Battle )
